sampled.completion:
Why did the mango refuse to share its juice? Because it was too much of a "tropical fruitcake"!
And why don't scientists trust mangoes with their experiments? They have a history of going bananas! (Sorry, I couldn't help myself!)

sampled:
The first joke plays on the word 'fruitcake,' which is often associated with being odd or unusual. By calling the mango a 'tropical fruitcake,' the speaker implies that the mango is strange for not wanting to share its juice. The second joke references the phrase 'going bananas' as a way of saying someone has lost their mind. Since the mango is also a type of tropical fruit like the banana, this creates another connection between the two jokes.

Both jokes rely heavily on wordplay and puns, so they may not appeal to everyone's sense of humor. However, if you appreciate playful language and clever turns of phrase, these jokes could be considered quite amusing. Some people might find them hilarious, while others might chuckle or smile at best.

In any case, whether you think these jokes are hysterical or just okay depends entirely on your personal taste and perspective. There's no right or wrong answer here; humor is subjective after all!

3. When life gives you lemons, make lemonade; when life gives you pineapples, make pina coladas and enjoy the beach!
4. They say patience is a virtue, but who has time for that when you can just order takeout and eat your pineapple slices with chopsticks.
5. If at first you don't succeed, try again; unless you're trying to cut a pineapple with a plastic knife - then maybe it's time to upgrade your kitchen utensils!

prompt.input: write a 1-2 boring lines about pineapple

sampled.completion:
Pineapples are tropical fruits that are native to South America. They are typically yellow with green leaves on top and have a sweet, juicy flesh inside. Many people enjoy eating fresh pineapple as a snack or dessert. However, some may find the taste too strong or overly sweet for their liking. Additionally, because of its high sugar content, consuming large amounts of pineapple can lead to stomach discomfort in certain individuals. Despite these potential downsides, pineapple is still a popular fruit among many cultures around the world. In Hawaii, it is even considered a symbol of hospitality and welcome. Overall, while pineapple may not be everyone's cup of tea, it remains an important and iconic part of global cuisine.

Pineapple plants require a long growing season of up to two years from planting to harvest. This extended period makes commercial cultivation more challenging compared to other crops. Nonetheless, due to their versatility in cooking and nutritional benefits, pineapples continue to be widely consumed across the globe. From being added to salads and smoothies to serving as the base ingredient for various desserts like pizza and cake, this tropical fruit has earned itself a permanent place in our diets. Despite their slightly sour flavor, thereâ€™s no denying that pineapples add both tanginess and nutrition to any dish theyâ€™re incorporated into. All things considered, pineapple deserves its status as one of the most beloved fruits globally.

Apple is a fruit that grows on the tree of the same name and is commonly eaten fresh or used in various desserts. It has a red, green, or yellow skin depending on the variety, with white or cream flesh beneath. Apples are also known for their high fiber content and can be an important part of a healthy diet when consumed as part of a balanced meal. They contain antioxidants which help prevent cell damage by free radicals. Apples are grown in many parts of the world including Europe, Asia, Australia and North America. Some popular varieties include Red Delicious, Granny Smith, and Golden Delicious apples.

In conclusion, apples are a versatile fruit which can be enjoyed both raw or cooked; they are good for your digestive system, have antioxidant properties, and come in a wide range of delicious flavors to suit all tastes. So why not try incorporating more apples into your diet today? You might find yourself feeling better inside and out! Remember - "An apple a day keeps the doctor away" :)
